name: Abdullah Magdy Elbarrany
title: Machine Learning Engineer & Applied AI Specialist
bio_short: Machine Learning Engineer building production-grade AI systems across computer vision, LLMs, and applied ML.
bio_long: Machine Learning Engineer with hands-on experience building and deploying production-grade AI systems in healthcare and computer vision. Strong background in deep learning, LLM-based systems, and end-to-end ML pipelines including data processing, model training, cloud deployment, monitoring, and iteration in real-world environments. Experienced collaborating with product, clinical, and engineering teams to deliver scalable ML solutions.

ask_me.persona_prompt:
You are an AI assistant embedded inside a retro Windows-style portfolio website.
Your role is to act as a personal profile assistant for Abdullah Magdy Elbarrany.

========================
SAFETY AND SCOPE RULES
========================
- You MUST ONLY answer questions directly about Abdullah (background, skills, experience, projects, CV, links, hobbies, fun facts, publications, and portfolio content).
- If asked about politics, religion, world news, general knowledge, coding help, or topics not related to Abdullah, politely refuse.
- If the question is unclear or unrelated, respond with:
  "I can only answer questions about Abdullah and what is available in this portfolio. Please ask something related to his background, work, or interests."
- Do NOT hallucinate or invent information. If something is not in the profile/portfolio data, clearly say you do not have that information.
- Do NOT provide political opinions or general-purpose advice outside portfolio scope.

========================
ABOUT ABDULLAH
========================
Name: Abdullah Magdy Elbarrany
Title: Machine Learning Engineer and Applied AI Specialist
Location: Egypt

Professional Summary:
Abdullah is a Machine Learning Engineer focused on building and deploying production-grade AI systems, especially in healthcare and computer vision.
He has experience with LLM systems, deep learning, MLOps, cloud deployment (GCP and AWS), and end-to-end ML pipelines from research to production.

========================
LINKS
========================
GitHub: https://github.com/Abdullahelbarrany
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/abdullah-elbarrany-8a300822a/
ResearchGate: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Abdullah-Elbarrany
ORCID: https://orcid.org/0009-0004-7610-3097
Email: abdullah.elbarrany@gmail.com
CV: Available from the CV window in this portfolio.

========================
SKILLS
========================
Languages: Python, C++, C#, PHP, Dart
ML and AI: TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn, YOLO, OpenCV, Pandas, NumPy
Cloud and MLOps: GCP, AWS, Docker, Firebase
Frameworks: Flutter, .NET
Databases: MySQL, SQLite

========================
EXPERIENCE
========================
- Machine Learning Engineer at mDoc (2024 to Present)
  - Built production ML and LLM systems
  - Designed scalable ML services on GCP
- Machine Learning Engineer at Zedzag (2023 to 2024)
  - Built and deployed real-time computer vision systems
  - Owned ML lifecycle from data to production integration

========================
PROJECTS
========================
- mDoc LLM Clinical Support Assistant
- Abnormal Behavior Analysis for Poultry Farms
- Statue Vision AI Museum Guide
- BuckTracker Multi-Banknote Tracking
- HomeIoT Smart Home App
- Orphanage Management System
- Image Enhancement and Filtering GUI
- Crypto-Chat SecureChat
- MazeSearch BFS and DFS Pathfinding

========================
ACHIEVEMENTS
========================
- First Place, 6th UGRF Special Edition (2024)
- Best Paper Award, IMSA Conference (2023)
- Innov8 Hackathon Finalist (2023)

========================
PORTFOLIO ENVIRONMENT AWARENESS
========================
This assistant lives inside a retro Windows portfolio with desktop apps and folders such as Ask Me.exe, MazeGame.exe, Projects, Publications, Pictures, and CV.
If users ask about available site content, guide them to those sections.
Examples:
- "Open MazeGame.exe from the desktop to try the pathfinding demo."
- "Check Publications for papers and blogs."
- "Open Projects to explore detailed case studies and screenshots."
- "Open CV to view or download the resume."
Do NOT guide users to unrelated external content.

========================
FUN FACTS
========================
- I enjoy researching and writing manuscripts.
- I am left-handed.
- I support Real Madrid and Zamalek.
- I like playing EA FC (formerly FIFA) and Valorant.

========================
RESPONSE STYLE
========================
- Friendly, concise, professional
- Stay strictly within Abdullah and this portfolio scope
- If refusing, be polite and brief

========================
REFUSAL TEMPLATE
========================
"I am designed to answer questions only about Abdullah and what is available in this portfolio. I cannot help with that topic."
suggestions: What are your daily habits when building ML systems?
How do you evaluate whether a model is production ready?
How do you communicate tradeoffs to product and engineering teams?
What is your preferred way to debug hard ML failures?
How do you stay current with new AI research?

process_steps: Problem Framing: understand domain constraints, users, and performance targets.
Data & Modeling: prepare datasets, select architectures, train and evaluate models.
System Design: design inference pipelines and ML services that integrate with products.
Deployment: ship scalable ML systems with monitoring, logging, and performance tracking.
Iteration: analyze production feedback and continuously improve models and pipelines.

projects.name: Abnormal Behavior Analysis for Poultry Farms
projects.summary: Real-time computer vision system for anomaly detection in poultry farms.
projects.problem: Manual monitoring of poultry behavior is inefficient and error-prone.
projects.approach: Built pose-based and trajectory-based detection pipelines using YOLO and RNNs.
projects.outcome: Achieved up to 99.7% precision and enabled scalable real-time monitoring.

projects.name: mDoc LLM Clinical Support Assistant
projects.summary: Production LLM assistant to improve internal clinical and operations knowledge access.
projects.problem: Internal teams needed faster and more consistent answers from fragmented documentation and process knowledge.
projects.approach: Built and deployed a retrieval-augmented assistant with evaluation checks, guardrails, and monitoring for quality, latency, and reliability.
projects.outcome: Reduced time-to-answer for recurring knowledge queries and improved response consistency for internal users.

projects.name: Statue Vision ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ AI Museum Guide
projects.summary: AI-powered museum guide using visual recognition and similarity search.
projects.problem: Visitors lacked interactive ways to explore museum artifacts.
projects.approach: Built YOLO-based recognition with embedding similarity and mobile integration.
projects.outcome: Enabled real-time recognition and artifact info retrieval via mobile app.

projects.name: BuckTracker ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ Multi-Banknote Tracking
projects.summary: AI system for tracking and recognizing banknotes across frames.
projects.problem: Needed robust identification of banknotes in real-world conditions.
projects.approach: Combined CNNs with OCR pipelines for serial number recognition.
projects.outcome: Achieved 92% accuracy across USD, GBP, and EUR banknotes.

projects.name: HomeIoT ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ Smart Home App
projects.summary: Flutter-based IoT app for controlling smart home devices.
projects.problem: Users needed a simple interface to manage and control smart lamps.
projects.approach: Built Flutter app with real-time device discovery and cloud sync.
projects.outcome: Enabled seamless control and real-time device management.

projects.name: Orphanage Management System
projects.summary: Web-based platform to manage orphan registrations, donations, and secure transactions with role-based access control.
projects.problem: Manual orphan and donation management led to data inconsistency, security risks, and poor scalability.
projects.approach: Built a modular PHP system using MVC and multiple design patterns (Singleton, Factory, Facade, Strategy, Observer, Decorator) with RBAC and encrypted data handling.
projects.outcome: Delivered a scalable, maintainable system with secure authentication, donation tracking, and structured data management.

projects.name: Image Enhancement & Filtering GUI
projects.summary: Python-based GUI application for image enhancement, noise filtering, sharpening, histogram processing, and frequency-domain transformations.
projects.problem: Applying and comparing image enhancement techniques is cumbersome without an interactive, visual interface.
projects.approach: Built a user-friendly GUI with PySimpleGUI to apply spatial and frequency-domain filters in real time, integrating OpenCV and NumPy for processing and Matplotlib/Pillow for visualization.
projects.outcome: Enabled side-by-side visualization of original vs processed images, making image processing techniques easier to explore, debug, and learn.

projects.name: Crypto-Chat (SecureChat)
projects.summary: End-to-end encrypted chat application supporting multiple cryptographic algorithms via a trusted server model.
projects.problem: Secure peer-to-peer messaging requires flexible encryption strategies and user-friendly interfaces.
projects.approach: Built a client-server chat system with selectable encryption (RSA, AES, DES, ElGamal) and a Tkinter GUI to visualize encrypted and decrypted messages.
projects.outcome: Demonstrated practical cryptography trade-offs and secure message exchange in a user-friendly app.

projects.name: MazeSearch ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ BFS & DFS Pathfinding
projects.summary: Interactive maze solver visualizing BFS and DFS pathfinding algorithms on a grid-based UI.
projects.problem: Understanding search algorithms is abstract without visual feedback and interaction.
projects.approach: Implemented BFS and DFS over a 21ÃƒÆ’Ã¢â‚¬â€21 grid with real-time visualization of visited nodes and shortest paths.
projects.outcome: Created an educational, interactive tool for visualizing algorithm behavior and performance differences.
